pageContext.desc: Notes kept during a voyage by a writer of historical romances.

pages.transcription:
COMPLIMENTS
NIAGARA
FIRE
INSURANCE Co
NEW YORK

Niagara Fire Insurance Co. of New York
[printed page decoration, image of Niagara Falls probably]
PETER NOTMAN, President.
THOS. F. GOODRICH, Vice-President.
GEO. C. HOWE, Secretary.
C. H. Post, Ass't Sec'y.
WEST POLLOCK, Sec'y City Dep't.
WESTERN DEPARTMENT, CHICAGO, ILLS.
I. S. BLACKWELDER, Manager. GEO. A. HOLLOWAY, Ass't Manager.

? Sea,
First few days 
people stiff about 
their ? to deck 
chairs, softening
off & perfect complaisance.
The rain has ? running along side of ship in break made by the pour/prow.

Lunches,
At Carlisle   .30
Sunday at [Leavington?] .24
Monday at Warwick .24
Tuesday /Thursday? at Stratford-on-Avon .48

The astonishing ? most passengers have ? seasickness, the ? they ? of ? others.
The sea is deep black towards evening, so it breaks? away from the ship, between foam and ?, the pale green like the spirit of water.

The swell of the sea, is ? ? pale blue; and the ? almost standing straight; + [white] caps like flecks of foam on the little waves. 
One soaks salt. You can taste it in your nails, your hand. The air is scarcely ? ? cold: it blows one

full of life. 
The sharp line of the sea against the horizon. Except in the gale?, [when/where] hillocks, villages, ?, all onto of ? size.
? see a whale blow, like puff or jet of white smoke from pistol. Then his great sides heaved an instant.

The ships far off like pale ghosts, or near, distinct and beautiful: [any/every] sail + mast informed with light.
Old [Sutternan?] sees birds flying, asks sailor what they are; he says "Mother Carey's chickens," "What?" "Mother Carey's chickens." Old man

goes back + tells his wife the sailor says they are prairie chickens.
We reach Queens-town in night about 2 O'clock, [Moonlight], lots of them [fit] up to see the coast. Many passengers [fit] off on lighter. The coast like a headland brown [valley] than

green.
The large young blonde man, wearing [? cafo/cafs?]. [It's thick] of smiling, the under eyelids being heavy, making a peculiarly sweet slimming?? look and smile,

Lights on the ? coast, the ?, the Bull and the Calf.
The churning sound of the machinery - rapid. The day and night noise of water ? along the sides of the boat.

Liverpool,
The first ? we see in the old world: a crimson blot among clouds in ? ?, over the harbor.
Imperial hotel, Bed with canopy open at top, + curtains. Small swinging [Toilets glass/flask?]. The slow ?.
? ?

is at 10.30 evening, ?, fish, roast +c, + fruit. We [fit] up from table about midnight.
Nothing remarkable, except, [slowness] in handling baggage.

Liverpool to Glasgow, July, 15, 1891,
Wonderful effect of dark stony walls on ? the ? ?. Such ?; such dappling ?, such old stone houses, Enormous ? ? at stations. 
Interlining hedges, ? on/in far hills
Where [little] ?, the ? seems [to]

? almost to the ?. ?, cattle, such farms, like heavenly visions of ? and gardens. 
Cumberland unclear dots on the [great [smiling?]] shoulders.

Far Scotlands?
Young [Caster leading horse] + ? cart in [barnyard]. He lifts his [arm] with 2 graceful [wares] as train [from past]
The [engines] on the Caledonian R.R. has a helmet policeman-hat shaped thing on the place when an American carbell? ? be.

1 man + 3 women [working] in fields, 
The [swelling, views] Scotch hills, with [clouds trailing] over.

Afr.
The lovely evening sea. Twilight here lasts until after 10 o'clock at night. 
The "? green" by the beach where a band plays, and ? think all, ? is [out], walking or playing here, until ? up and ? ?, and ?

it [swarming]. 
From [O'Shanty] ? in Stitch.St.
Meet bagpiper piping.
This afternoon the party drove to Burns birthplace + [Alloway] Road. Such a mark as the inside of that church! The [rocky] walls + ? bunch of term, the lamb

inside second inclosure, the old ?, the ? at ? of ? ? where Burns was christened. [Hard finds] a bunch of ?.
The [bones] of ?, the old ? of Devon.

In Ayr? they walk much to the middle of the street.
Carlisle.
? in ? thinking [we] have only 45 minutes, drive the cathedral, see finest old stained glass windows in England, dating from Richard II; [?]

arches which have [stood? as ? since a fire] 500 years ago. Then to [Rickerly's], up a narrow [pond] lane. St. Cuthbert's lane. Little shop into which [? to ?]. It has old sterling [?], forks, old [?] and china &c. We make hasty purchases.
The British lunch [basket] is an institution

institution: a ? looking ? sausage, a chicken and sandwich, and ?. You can [buy?] a large lunch for 35[c] and leave basket in train and it will be ? ? ?.
[In these] railway carriages are racks overhead for small parcels, and sometimes cords to hold men's hats by brim.

[Having ? sometimes] with terrific speed.
The British baby cab looks like a little casket. Almost springless, and [?]. Bare [?] babies, often bare armed.
Leamington.
Have + ? ? - Mr's Gordans, very beautiful with ? flowers, ? of lilies +c.

St ?
Messrs. Von der Beck + [Marsily],
Red Star Line,
[Kaverner]strasse,
Antwerp.
